response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (18)", "high", "Being a young adult is associated with higher recidivism risk due to greater impulsivity and peer influence."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "medium", "Males statistically have a higher likelihood of recidivism, but gender is one of several moderate risk factors."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race alone here does not substantially elevate risk relative to other factors."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest, conviction)", "high", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate a history of criminal behavior, significantly increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Living Situation (living alone)", "medium", "Living alone may reduce social support and oversight, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Educational Status (High school diploma, enrolled in college)", "low", "Enrollment in college and completion of high school indicate positive prospects and reduced risk."],
    ["Employment Status (No job in past year)", "high", "Lack of recent employment can contribute to economic instability and is a strong risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana and cocaine use in past four years)", "high", "Recent substance use, especially involving cocaine, significantly elevates the risk of recidivism due to its association with criminal behavior."],
    ["Family Background (Lived with biological mother in a small household)", "medium", "A small household and early family environment may impact stability moderately, affecting recidivism risk."],
    ["Residence (Urban area)", "medium", "Urban living can expose individuals to environments with higher crime rates, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Religiosity (Believes God has a role in personal events)", "low", "A sense of spirituality may offer some protective factors, thereby lowering risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult is associated with higher recidivism risk due to greater impulsivity and peer influence.
Males statistically have a higher likelihood of recidivism, but gender is one of several moderate risk factors.
Race alone here does not substantially elevate risk relative to other factors.
A prior arrest and conviction indicate a history of criminal behavior, significantly increasing recidivism risk.
Living alone may reduce social support and oversight, contributing moderately to risk.
Educational Status (High school diploma, enrolled in college)
Enrollment in college and completion of high school indicate positive prospects and reduced risk.
Employment Status (No job in past year)
Lack of recent employment can contribute to economic instability and is a strong risk factor for recidivism.
Substance Use (Marijuana and cocaine use in past four years)
Recent substance use, especially involving cocaine, significantly elevates the risk of recidivism due to its association with criminal behavior.
Family Background (Lived with biological mother in a small household)
A small household and early family environment may impact stability moderately, affecting recidivism risk.
Urban living can expose individuals to environments with higher crime rates, contributing moderately to risk.
Religiosity (Believes God has a role in personal events)
A sense of spirituality may offer some protective factors, thereby lowering risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 153 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 2, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
